content: Financial Aid Financial Aid Basics Types of Aid Receive Aid Maintain Eligibility Manage Costs Repay Loans Resources for...ParentsNew/Incoming StudentsCurrent StudentsDeparting Students Parents New/Incoming Students Current Students Departing Students Forms Contact Us Apply Online Request Info Visit Campus DePaul University>Admission & Aid>Financial Aid>Resources for...>Departing Students Resources for Departing Students Whether you're graduating, transferring or leaving school, here's everything you need to know about what happens to your aid as you prepare to depart DePaul. The Office of Financial Aid can help make this a smooth transition.Contact us. Repay Loans— How much will your monthly payments be? When will they begin? Make sure you know the answers. Loan Forgiveness— There are loan forgiveness programs for those in public service and teaching. Find out if you qualify. Loan Exit Counseling— Some forms of aid require you to complete online loan exit counseling prior to leaving DePaul. Return Title IV Aid— If you received Title IV funds, DePaul is required to review your eligibility to determine if any aid must be repaid to the federal government. Appeal Suspension— If your financial aid has been suspended because you failed to meet minimum academic requirements, you can submit an appeal. Withdrawal from Classes— Learn what can happen to your current or future aid if you need to withdraw. Contact Us— We're always here to help. Give us a call, send us an email or stop by the office.
